content: Develop a rap song that discusses the importance of staying true to oneself amidst external pressures. The lyrics should be thought-provoking and have a strong rhythmic flow.

Verse 1:
Yo, listen up, I got a story to tell,
'Bout staying true, even when the world is hell.
Pressure's on, from every angle, it seems,
But I'm here to say, be yourself, that's the theme.

Chorus:
Stay true, stay real, don't let 'em change your tune,
Your voice is loud, your heart is your boom.
External pressures, they try to bend your will,
But remember this, you are more than a shell.

Verse 2:
Society's gaze, it can be so cold,
Telling you what to do, how to mold.
But I say, rise above, don't let 'em define,
Your path is yours, your soul is divine.

Chorus:
Stay true, stay real, don't let 'em change your tune,
Your voice is loud, your heart is your boom.
External pressures, they try to bend your will,
But remember this, you are more than a shell.

Bridge:
Look inside, find your core,
Strength resides where you've been before.
Don't fade away, stand your ground,
Your uniqueness is what makes you profound.

Verse 3:
Friends may stray, trends may shift,
But your integrity, that's what's left.
Stay authentic, through thick and thin,
Your true self is where your power begins.

Chorus:
Stay true, stay real, don't let 'em change your tune,
Your voice is loud, your heart is your boom.
External pressures, they try to bend your will,
But remember this, you are more than a shell.

Outro:
So here's to those who dare to be,
To stay true, to set themselves free.
Embrace your authenticity, let it shine,
In a world that tries to make you decline.

[End of Song]
